header.title: SET: THE FURY OF EGYPT
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Left Hand Path, Draconian Tradition, Egyptian Magic, Sethianism, Qliphoth, Chaos Magic, Hermetics

central_thesis: This anthology offers a deep dive into the multifaceted nature and role of the Egyptian deity Set from the perspective of the Draconian Tradition and the Left Hand Path. It posits Set as a primal archetype of the Adversary, embodying dynamic change, chaos, and self-deification, providing both theoretical insights and practical rituals for initiates to achieve personal transformation and higher consciousness.

structure_content.chapter_title: Lord of Storm and Change (Asenath Mason)
structure_content.summary: Explores Set's historical and mythological background, his ambivalent nature as both creator and destroyer, and his significance in the Left Hand Path as an archetype for self-deification and the Black Flame. Discusses his connection to storm, chaos, and transformation, contrasting him with Osiris, and notes his various names and animal associations.

Examines overlooked aspects of Set's character, including the etymology of his name, his historical connection to Aset (Isis), his nomadic nature, and the persistent mystery surrounding the Set-animal head. Proposes theories ranging from composite animals to extinct species, and also highlights Set's less common role as a protector of light.

structure_content.chapter_title: Hymns of Adoration to Setekh (Edgar Kerval)
structure_content.summary: Presents a practical rite of devotion to Setekh, describing the necessary offerings and a specific method for trance induction using various 'mask names.' Includes a detailed 'Hymn of Glorification' and an 'Invocation: THE AWAKENING' aimed at invoking Setekh's power as a devourer of souls and master of the underworld, with a focus on the 'Black Sun in Amenti.'

structure_content.chapter_title: My Journey into the Desert with Set (Mimi Hazim)
structure_content.summary: A personal account of a practitioner's alliance with Set, describing him as a profound teacher and initiator rather than merely a god of chaos. Details experiences of 'spiritual dismemberment and re-birth,' egoic transmutation, and the development of heightened empathy and sensitivity, highlighting Set's role in confronting the shadow self and achieving liberation through suffering.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Role of Set in Western Occultism (Fra Diavolo)
structure_content.summary: Contextualizes Set within Western Esotericism, linking him to the hermetic theory of elements (specifically Fire), the Kabbalistic Tree of Life (Netzach and Satariel on the Qliphoth), and the concept of 'death' as a transformative process. Compares Set to Saturn/Kronos, emphasizing his function as a 'transformer' who forces reorientation.

Outlines a group ritual designed to invoke Set's strength and power for self-transformation. Specifies ritual setup (triangle, candles, dagger, mask, sacrament) and steps, including invocations and visualizations of Set manifesting and merging with the invocant, leading to a redefinition of the self.

structure_content.chapter_title: Breaking Boundaries: A Sexual Encounter with Set (Soror Sortela)
structure_content.summary: A personal narrative describing a sexual magickal working with Set that facilitated the author's realization and grounding of their transgender identity. Presents a secret mantra ('TANGAROS') for calling Set and a 'Liber' of philosophical verses ('The Philosophy of Self-Becoming') outlining principles of self-liberation and rebellion within the Draconian Path.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Flaming Star of Set (Asenath Mason)
structure_content.summary: Details a 7-day working project aimed at attuning consciousness to Set's current and awakening the five 'Dragon' psychic senses (clairvoyance, clairaudience, clairscent, clairgustance, clairtangency). Uses an inverted pentagram, the 'Eye of Set' sigil, and specific candle meditations, culminating in the full experience of 'Set-consciousness.'

structure_content.chapter_title: The Many Faces of Set (Asenath Mason)
structure_content.summary: A 6-day follow-up project to 'The Flaming Star of Set,' focusing on invoking Set's consciousness through five specific masks/aspects: The Isolator, Lord of the Desert, Initiator of the Inner Flame, God of Storms, and The Watcher. Each working aims to facilitate self-deification by exploring and embodying these aspects.

Describes a ritual working centered on the archetype of inner fire, combining Set, Lucifer, and Azazel. Utilizes Kundalini-raising techniques, specifically the 'trident position' and 'ankhing' (Egyptian Tantra) with 'breath of fire,' to activate and direct inner energy for evolution, transcendence, and overcoming obstacles.

structure_content.chapter_title: Baptized in the Ecstasy of Poison (Cătălina Deaconu)
structure_content.summary: A poetic and philosophical exploration of Set as the 'Creator and Destroyer,' transcending boundaries and defying death. Discusses various etymological interpretations of Set's name ('overmastering,' 'overpassing,' 'to intoxicate') and his connection to the 'abortive character,' emphasizing self-creation, the liberation of the 'innermost Dragon,' and the transcendence of duality.

A personal narrative detailing a 13-day working with Set, focusing on establishing an intimate connection. Describes receiving a personal sigil and experiencing Set as a guide who brings laughter, vivid imagery, and peace amidst chaos and destruction, challenging previous perceptions of him as solely destructive.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Gods of the Underworld (Bill Duvendack)
structure_content.summary: Analyzes Nephthys, sister and consort of Set, as a dark goddess priestess of death and funerary rites. Discusses her historical context, her relationship with Anpu and Set, and her shared characteristics with Set (death, storms, violence). Highlights her unique role as a protectress of life and her connection to Atlantis for accessing ancient information.

structure_content.chapter_title: Set and Nephthys Chaos and Void (Asenath Mason)
structure_content.summary: Explores the complementary dynamic between Set (chaos, manifestation) and Nephthys (stillness, void) within Draconian magic. Presents a ritual for meditating on their combined sigil and invoking Nephthys to find clarity and understanding amidst the chaos of Set, emphasizing her role as the 'eye in the center of the tornado' for personal transformation.

structure_content.chapter_title: EGYPTIAN LEFT-HAND PATH MAGICK - The Neter Set and the Black Alchemy of the Ba and Ka (Michael W. Ford, Akhtya Dahak Azal’ucel, Sasutekhwoser V˚)
structure_content.summary: Introduces the theoretical framework of Luciferian and Sethanic Magick, defining initiation as self-determined actualization through the 11 Points of Power and the Triad of the Morning Star. Explains Heka (Magick), Ba (manifest power/soul-mate), and Ka (soul/double) as fundamental Egyptian concepts, detailing their significance and utilization in Sethanic practice for enhancing consciousness and achieving Apotheosis.

structure_content.chapter_title: CASTING THE HERMETIC CIRCLE (Michael W. Ford, Akhtya Dahak Azal’ucel, Sasutekhwoser V˚)
structure_content.summary: Provides practical instructions for casting a 'Basic Hermetic Sethanic Magick Circle.' Details the setup with candles representing Triads of Light (Amun-Ra, Osiris, Isis) and Darkness (Seth-An, Anubis, Sekhmet) and the Four Sons of Horus. Emphasizes the circle as a tool for focusing energy and achieving gnosis through Will, Desire, and Belief, rather than mere protection.

key_concepts.definition: A central Egyptian deity in the Draconian/Left Hand Path context, portrayed as the archetype of the Adversary, god of storm, change, the desert, and chaos. He is viewed as a self-created god, an initiator of the Black Flame, and a symbol for self-deification, individual transcendence, and the destruction of stagnation. His nature is often ambivalent, embodying both destructive and protective aspects.

A spiritual and magical path emphasizing self-initiation, self-liberation, and individual sovereignty. It involves challenging restrictive beliefs, societal norms, and the natural order to achieve personal power and a god-like state of consciousness.

A magical tradition focused on awakening and developing the 'Dragon force' or Kundalini within the practitioner. It emphasizes self-deification, working with primal, often chaotic, energies, and a direct, experiential approach to spiritual evolution.

A core concept representing the inner spark of Godhood, individual consciousness, and the source of personal power and evolutionary potential within man. Its ignition is central to the self-initiatory process on the Left Hand Path.

The ultimate goal of the Draconian and Sethanic paths, where the initiate transforms into a god-like being through personal gnosis, mastery of destiny, and realization of their inner divine potential. This involves breaking boundaries, transcending limitations, and recreating oneself according to one's will.

The 'Tree of Death' or 'Other Side' in Kabbalistic traditions, representing the dark, inverted emanations and primal forces opposite the Sephiroth. Explored in the Draconian context as a path of self-knowledge and transformation, confronting 'demons and abominations' as parts of oneself to be integrated and transcended.

key_concepts.term: Eye of Set (Eye of the Dragon)
key_concepts.definition: A symbolic representation of awakened and self-deified consciousness. It is formed by SATA, the serpent of the underworld in its double aspect, embodying cycles of death and rebirth central to the initiatory process. In rituals, it is a focal point for channeling Set's energies.

Extrasensory perceptions developed through Draconian workings, replacing or enhancing physical senses. These include clairvoyance (clear seeing/inner sight), clairaudience (inner hearing), clairscent (psychic smell), clairgustance (psychic taste), and clairtangency (clear touching/psychometry). They attune the practitioner to astral energies and other dimensions.

The evolutionary force, described as the foundation of all life and the source of immortality. In Tantric and Draconian practices, it is activated and directed through the subtle body for spiritual ascent, energy balance, and liberation. Symbolically represented by the letter Shin and Teth.

The Egyptian deification of Magick as a creative force, inherent within the gods and connected to the cosmic order. In Sethanic and Luciferian Magick, it is identified as the inherent power connected with the Ka, enhanced by Will, Desire, and Belief, utilized for creative or destructive acts.

In Egyptian concepts, the Ba represents a deity or human in their totality of physical and spiritual/psychic capacities and traits. It is the manifestation of power and the animating spirit or essence based on mental attributes, capable of dwelling in Nun and manifesting in various forms.

In Egyptian concepts, the Ka is the 'soul' or 'double' of the individual, representing their vital essence and accumulated energy. It is believed to inhabit statues and requires nourishment after physical death, directly connected to Heka as the source of its power and enhanced by Luciferian practice.

A mysterious zoomorphic creature depicted with Set, characterized by long rectangular ears, a curved snout, a thin forked tail, and a canine body. Its exact identity is unknown and subject to debate, symbolizing Set's primordial, untamed, and enigmatic nature.

An ancient Egyptian knife used for cutting the umbilical cord and in the Opening of the Mouth Ceremony. Symbolically, it represents birth, death, destiny, and isolation, used in Sethanic rituals to cut ties to the mundane world and facilitate rebirth.

A Sethanic-Hermetic concept used in ceremonial magick to balance opposing factions or deities. The Triad of Light includes Amun-Ra, Osiris, and Isis, while the Triad of Darkness includes Seth-An, Anubis, and Sekhmet. Practitioners work with these to understand balance and utilize their respective energies.

practical_system.description: The book outlines a comprehensive practical system for self-initiation, transformation, and self-deification centered on the Egyptian god Set. This system employs direct invocation, god-form assumption, elaborate meditative visualizations, and energy-raising techniques, often performed within a ritual circle or pentagram. Core mechanics include activating the 'Black Flame' (individual consciousness/divine spark), developing five 'Dragon senses' (psychic abilities), and channeling the Kundalini/Serpent Force through specific body postures and breathwork. The system integrates mythological, Qabalistic (Qliphothic), and Tantric elements, all reinterpreted through a Sethanic/Luciferian lens to emphasize individual will, the embrace of chaotic transformative energies, and the dissolution of limitations for personal ascent.
tools: Sigils (Set, Eye of Set, Nephthys and Set)
Pentagram (physical or astral, inverted often for LHP)
Black candles (representing Set, various masks, or darkness)
Red candles (representing pentagram points, psychic flames)
Incense (Dragon's Blood, Nile Temple, Kyphi, frankincense, myrrh)
Dagger/Knife/Razor (for symbolic self-sacrifice, cutting ties, ritual gestures)
Chalice (for sacrament, red wine or liquid)
Statues/Images of Set and other invoked deities
rituals: Hymns of Adoration to Setekh (Edgar Kerval): Utilizes mask names for trance, followed by a hymn and invocation to Setekh, focusing on his underworld mastery and gnosis through the 'Black Sun in Amenti.'

The Ritual of Set-Transformation (Fra Diavolo): A group ritual involving a triangle setup, black candles, dagger, and sacrament, designed for invoking Set to facilitate profound personal transformation and redefinition of self.

The Flaming Star of Set (Asenath Mason): A 7-day personal working to awaken and develop five psychic 'Dragon senses' (clairvoyance, clairaudience, clairscent, clairgustance, clairtangency) using an inverted pentagram, the 'Eye of Set' sigil, and specific candle meditations, culminating in 'Set-consciousness.'

The Many Faces of Set (Asenath Mason): A 6-day project to invoke and embody Set's consciousness through various masks—The Isolator, Lord of the Desert, Initiator of the Inner Flame, God of Storms, and The Watcher—for self-deification and exploration of his diverse archetypes.

The Lord of Fire (Asenath Mason): A ritual combining Set, Lucifer, and Azazel as Lords of Fire, employing a 'trident posture,' 'ankhing' visualization, and 'breath of fire' Kundalini-raising to activate inner fire for evolution, transcendence, and obstacle destruction.

Set and Nephthys Chaos and Void (Asenath Mason): A working focusing on the interplay of Set (chaos) and Nephthys (stillness/void). Involves meditating on their sigil, chanting specific mantras, and invoking Nephthys to gain clarity and access hidden knowledge from within chaos.

THE BASIC HERMETIC SETHANIC MAGICK CIRCLE (Michael W. Ford): A foundational ritual for casting a ceremonial circle. It involves invoking Triads of Light (Amun-Ra, Osiris, Isis) and Darkness (Seth-An, Anubis, Sekhmet) and the Four Sons of Horus, with candles and specific hymns, aiming to focus energy and achieve gnosis.

relevant_quotes.text: In modern times, Set is the initiator of the Black Flame and one of the patron deities of the Left Hand Path. His title “he who isolates” refers in Setian mysteries to the concept of isolated and awakened consciousness, and the Black Flame can be viewed as a symbol of the inner center, the source of individuality, personal power and evolutionary potential of man.

Set asks us to take over control and to ascend to the throne. This is not an invitation to violence or hatred because it is about the “Self,” Take control of your being and becoming, grow, be what you want to be. Question the existing, start something new and separate yourself from things that prevent you from growing, this is the way of Set.

I am the blade that cuts through the stifling web of stagnation and inertia, I am the lust and fury that shall not be constrained, I am the untamed force that shakes foundations of the universe, And I am the flame that turns man into god!
The Black Flame is essentially Heka as it is infused with the Ba and Ka of the Black Adept.

The Luciferian watches and discovers the basic tools of Luciferian Magick which are found as a result of applying the 11 Points of Power consistently. The method of perceiving not only your opinions, beliefs and outward ways in which you view the world is the most important method of initiation.

Resistance and fear is what makes the journey painful. Surrender can be a great act of liberation. It is the difference between choosing to stand in the eye of the storm, or to choose to allow ourselves to get trapped and caught up in the chaotic debris of the external and illusory world.

critical_analysis.relevance: The book is highly relevant for contemporary Left Hand Path practitioners, especially those within the Draconian Tradition, by offering a comprehensive framework for engaging with Set. It meticulously integrates diverse occult concepts from ancient Egyptian mythology, Qabalah (Qliphoth), Hermeticism, and Tantra, providing both deep theoretical understanding and actionable ritualistic practices. Its emphasis on self-deification, personal gnosis, and the transformative power of chaos aligns perfectly with modern occult trends that prioritize individual spiritual sovereignty and development. The work acts as a practical manual for internal and external alchemical processes, making it a valuable resource for advanced practitioners.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience consists primarily of experienced practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those aligned with the Left Hand Path, Draconian Tradition, Sethianism, and Luciferianism. It also appeals to intermediate occultists seeking to deepen their practical engagement with Egyptian deities and complex magical systems. A foundational understanding of occult concepts is assumed, making it less suitable for absolute beginners without prior study in these areas.
